A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
A visually stunning injustice to a beloved franchise. This movie was both AWESOME and REALLY BAD.TLJ is full of gorgeous space battles and awesome moments (which on their own are great). But\, in the larger context of the entire saga\, it ripped the heart out of what we all loved about Star Wars like Mola Ram in Temple of Doom. The nerd in me left the theatre stunned\, confused and conflicted because I really did enjoy TLJ in the moment. But\, once I had a few nights to ponder and digest.. this film did not live up to the hype and detracted from SW movie magic. 

Seeing Yoda - awesome.
Space battles - awesome.
Mon Calamari Star Cruiser ramming the Supremacy at light speed - one of the most epic cinema moments of all time.

Ray's continued mastery of the force without an ounce of training or explanation. Her parents reveal better be a misdirect. 
Snoke is an arrogant nothingburger. He better be still alive/the whole thing was an Astro Projection.
Lukes character was assassinated and sent off in the worst way possible. No justice is done here at all.
Lea's moments in the movie were cringe-worthy and "WTF?" inducing 
Plot was poorly constructed
Character motivations were flawed (JUST TELL POE THE PLAAAAANNN)
The casino scene/side mission completely useless - movie would have been better if they figured out a different way of getting Finn into Supremacy and spent the time on Luke and Ray
Phasma underwhelmed again
I can keep going...... But.. I'm starting to feel the 2-star rating is a little generous.. so I will end right here.

P.S.
Jewbacca kills and cooks a porg... then won't eat it?!? C'mon!
